posts.title: Today - Bernard I. Fain Lecture in Economics
posts.description:
The Bernard I. Fain Lecture is presented annually by the Department of Economics. This year's lecturer, Jos� Manuel Campa, is Professor of Financial Management at IESE Business School and until recently served as the Secretary of State for Economic Affairs in Spain´s Ministry of Economy and Finance. The title of his talk is "Challenges in the Adjustment of the Euro Area".
Friday, December 7, 2012 4:00 PM - 5:15 PM, Salomon center, Room 001.

posts.title: Economics in the Real World Symposium
posts.description:
The symposium "Economics in the Real World" is organized by the Economics Department. This year the symposium is devoted to the economic crisis in Europe.
The discussion participants are Professor Michael Klein (Tufts University), Nicola Cetorelli, Economist, Federal Reserve Bank of New York, Professor Gauti Eggertsson (Brown University), Professor Jose Manuel Campa (IESE).
December 8, Saturday, 9 am - 12 pm. Salomon Center Room 001.

posts.title: Spring Break in Mississippi
posts.description:
Come hear about a unique opportunity to apply for a spot to study the South in the South for a week and have an experience of a lifetime in the Mississippi Delta and at Tougaloo College.

Professor Francoise Hamlin will meet with interested students on Monday, December 10, 2012 at 12:00 noon.

Location: Churchill House lower level (Africana Studies, 155 Angell Street).

Contact: Professor Francoise Hamlin.

posts.title: PHOTOS WANTED OF BROWN'S CAMPUS
posts.description:
Have awesome high-quality photographs of Brown's campus? Submit them to reach@brown.edu with the subject line
"Photo Submission" as soon as possible, and your photo could be featured on the cover of next year's student planner!You will receive credit on the cover.

We are looking for images of at least 300dpi that capture quintessential features of Brown. This means NO iPhone/Instagram quality photos. Portrait photos are preferred. You may submit multiple photos.

posts.title: CFAR Special Presentation: Friday at 3pm
posts.description:
Please join us for a Center for AIDS Research (CFAR) special presentation:

"From the National HIV/AIDS Strategy to Ryan White to Improved Population-Level Viral Suppression: Exploring Critical Roles for Researchers to Lead the Way"

Friday, Dec 7th at 3pm
Alpert Medical School
Case Study Room 275

Presented by Jeffrey Crowley: Distinguished Scholar and Program Director of the National HIV/AIDS Initiative at Georgetown Law, Director of the White House Office of National AIDS Policy, 2009-2011

posts.title: Manage Stress Tip #3: Have a Snack
posts.description: When you're busy it can be hard to find time to eat. But if you make it a priority to eat a snack every few hours and drink plenty of water, it will keep your blood sugar up, improve your brain function and energy levels, and make it easier to get through finals. Try it. Simple suggestions for stressful circumstances brought to you by Health Education. For more tips on reducing stress, click below.

posts.title: Student Tickets for Men's Basketball vs Providence
posts.description: From today until December 13, Brown Students can pick up their FREE student ticket for the men's basketball game against Providence College on December 28, at 7 p.m. Students should go to the Brown Ticket Office at Pizzitola Center and bring their Brown ID card. There will be only 200 tickets available for students and limit is 1 ticket per student. Students will have to show Brown ID with the ticket at the game. For questions, call 401-863-2773.

posts.title: Re-Enact a Riot!
posts.description:
Invite all of your friends to come act in or watch our Final Project for HIST 1030 Long Fall of the Roman Empire! We are re-enacting a pivotal moment in the rule of Eastern Roman Emperor Justinian, the Nika Riots. Come see violence and political intrigue, and maybe learn something too!

Kaspar Multipurpose Room at Noon on 12/8!!!

posts.title: Unhemmed - last issue of the semester out today!
posts.description:
Unhemmed Magazine is out today (Friday 12/7)!

Take a study break and click over to unhemmedmagazine.com to read the last issue of the semester!

Unhemmed Magazine is more than just a fashion magazine, celebrating Brown students' style, culture, and the arts.

posts.title: IMPROVidence Presents The Last Show
posts.description:
WINTER IS UPON US.

THE WINT'RY BLUSTERS BLOW US FARTHER FROM EACH OTHER.

COME THAW YOUR HEART WITH IMPROVIDENCE,
AND BID ADIEU TO DR. GAYBONES IN HS LAST SHOW.

"The Last Show"
Lower Salomon
Friday, December 7
9:30 PM
$1

(Unless you find Gabe before the show and give him a kiss, then it's free.)
(Unless he doesn't want you to kiss him, then it's a dollar anyway suckahs.)

posts.title: Le Salon (French Conversation hours) Last Meeting!
posts.description: Come practice your French speaking skills in a friendly, low-key environment one last time this semester with Le Salon. We'll be having our last fall meeting today, Friday December 7th, in JWW 303 from 5-6pm. All levels welcome. Food + beverages will be served. Nous serions ravis de vous voir.

posts.title: Liman Public Interest Fellowship Campus Deadline
posts.description: The campus deadline for the Liman Public Interest Fellowship is 5pm on January 7, 2013. This fellowship supports undergraduates who want to spend the summer working in the area of public interest law or to engage in advocacy work that shapes public policy. For more information about applying for the Liman, please click on the link below.

posts.title: LGBTQ Center seeking LGBTQ Mentors
posts.description: The LGBTQ Center is seeking lesbian, gay, bisexual, pansexual, queer, same-gender loving, transgender and gender queer faculty and staff mentors to participate in our Renn Mentoring Program. Anyone who identifies as LGBTQ+ is welcome to apply. We are especially in need of mentors who identify as people of color, trans, gender queer, bisexual, pansexual or men at this time. For information and an application please visit the link below or email Kelly_Garrett@brown.edu.

posts.title: Come see Next to Normal
posts.description:
Come see Musical Forum's production of
NEXT TO NORMAL

Book & Lyrics by Brian Yorkey
Music by Tom Kitt

Directed by Zach Rufa '14
Musical Direction by Ben Kutner '14

Winner of the 2010 Pulitzer Prize for Drama

Friday December 7th, 8 PM
Saturday December 8th, 8 PM
Sunday December 9th, 2 PM and 8 PM
Monday December 10th, 8 PM

In the Production Workshop Downspace @ 7 Young Orchard Avenue

Tickets available an hour before the show at the door.

posts.title: iGEM Info Sessions: Do Syn Bio @ NASA!
posts.description: Looking for a summer science internship that's innovative, fast-paced, high-stakes, and fun that comes with a stipend and the prestige of NASA?  Apply to be on the award-winning Stanford-Brown iGEM team.  We genetically engineer biological machines (synthetic biology), and are looking for biologists, engineers, computer scientists, etc.  Info sessions FRIDAY Dec 7 AT 4 and SATURDAY Dec 8 at 4 in Wilson 101.

posts.title: Paper&Pixel Release Party Friday Dec 7!
posts.description: Paper & Pixel, Brown's only photography magazine, will be having a release party this Friday December 7 in the Chandelier Room JWW501 @ 8 pm.  Come pick up our winter 2012 issue full of glossy photos featuring the best of Brown's photographers.  Cheese and crackers abound.

posts.title: * * * TEACH IN PROVIDENCE WITH LEARNING EXCHANGE!
posts.description:
Learning Exchange is a Science Center Outreach program that seeks to teach kids creative analytical thinking. We make games and animations in Scratch as well as paper planes and bridges. You'll get a chance to apply your skills in a real classroom -- it's a great way to get off College Hill and make a difference.

Apply now!

Sponsored by Brown Science Center.
(You can also email us at brownlearningexchange@gmail.com.)

posts.title: MCM CIn�math�que presents films from the archive!
posts.description: Join us for the last Cin�math�que screening of the semester! Help us close out the season with a strong attendance! Come to Production 101 in 135 Thayer Street (enter from Benevolent Street) this Friday, December 7th at 6:00pm for Ulrike Ottinger's TICKET OF NO RETURN (1979) and at 7:55pm for Mike Leigh's NAKED (1993). Screenings are always free and always presented in 16mm. The Cin�math�que will resume at the end of January, 2013.

posts.title: PSAB Presents - Bilal Khan Concert: Live at Brown
posts.description:
The Pakistani Students Association at Brown proudly brings to you Bilal Khan, the young Pakistani music sensation who has recently rocked every local music chart. Bilal is on his first US tour and we are proud to welcome him to Brown for a live event.

Friday, December 7
9:30 pm
Smitty B 106
Free Admission

posts.title: One Million Bones: Bone-Making and Free Pizza!
posts.description:
For International Human Rights Day, come by the Kasper multipurpose anytime from 12-2pm on December 10th (Monday)! We are making bones for the One Million Bones project. Click here to learn more and watch a short video:
http://www.onemillionbones.org/

There will be free pizza! We'd love to see you there.

Sponsered by STAND at Brown, GlobeMed at Brown, Brown in Burma, and the Brown Human Rights Report

posts.title: Jonathan Strauss: From Erotics to Ethics...
posts.description:
Please join the Department of French Studies for a lecture (in English) presented by Jonathan Strauss on Wednesday, December 12th at 5:30PM entitled "From Erotics to Ethics: Phantasmatic Remainders in Lacan, Blanchot, and Kristeva."

The lecture will be held in the Rochambeau House Music room located at 84 Prospect Street, a reception will follow.

posts.title: Projects for Peace Campus Deadline - 1/11/13
posts.description: The campus deadline for Projects for Peace is January 11, 2013 and is open to all undergraduates including seniors who would complete their projects after graduation.  Students are invited to design grassroots projects that they will implement during the summer. Brown will select among its internal applicant pool one proposal and one alternate proposal.  The two chosen projects from Brown will be submitted to the Davis Foundation. If successful the project(s) would be funded at $10,000 each.

posts.title: Pharmacy Reminder
posts.description:
The pharmacy will be closed from 12/22/12 through 1/1/13. Please plan accordingly and refill your prescriptions before the break as we will not be available to transfer your prescriptions during that time.

Thanks, Paul-Pharmacy 401-863-7882

posts.title: Mark L. Shapiro Lecture Series in Philosophy
posts.description: Please join the Philosophy Department on Friday, December 7 from 4:00 -6:00 p.m. for the inaugural Mark L. Shapiro Lecture Series in Philosophy, presented by Professor David Charles, Oriel College, Oxford. Friday's topic is "Practical Truth: Aristotelian Reflections." The talk will take place in Smith-Buonanno 106, with a reception to follow in the lobby.

posts.title: Brown Madrigal Singers Winter Concert
posts.description: Brown's only classical a cappella group warmly invites you to our winter concert, featuring carols, madrigals, polyphony, and much more! The concert will take place on Friday, December 7 at 8:00 pm in Manning Chapel and is completely FREE of charge. Please join us!

posts.title: Office of Financial AId - Closes early on 12/14
posts.description: The Office of Financial Aid will be closing early on Friday, 12/14/12 at 12:00 pm (Noon) for our Holiday Celebration. We will re-open on Monday 12/17/12 at 8:30 a.m. For urgent matters, please email us at financial_aid@brown.edu. Happy Holidays to All!

posts.title: TODAY Cru Brown Dinner
posts.description:
Join us TONIGHT 12/7 @ 6PM for a free, home-cooked meal and good conversation at the warm, historic Judson House (168 Lloyd Ave.). This week, we will be reflecting on this semester and planning for our international Christmas party. All spiritual backgrounds are invited.

Who: YOU
When: 12/7 6-8PM
Where: 168 Lloyd Ave. (2 blocks past CVS)

posts.title: BROWN STAND UP COMICS Presents: The Alpacalips
posts.description:
Come watch funny people be funny.

Brown Stand Up Comics is holding it's last show of the semester, the calendar year, and maybe even the world!

When: Friday, December 7 at 8pm
Where: MacMillan 117
Why: Becauuuuse.

posts.title: Connect with Brown is Green!
posts.description:
What percentage of Brown students recycle? How many tons of green house gas do we produce? How can I get involved with sustainability at Brown? Connect with Brown is Green on Facebook (http://www.facebook.com/JoinBrownIsGreen) for weekly tips and fun facts about Brown's energy and environmental initiatives.

Are you doing great green things in your student group or department? We want to hear about it! Share them on our page and you may even be featured in our annual sustainability report!

posts.title: Learning Exchange Final Event
posts.description: Learning Exchange is having a final ceremony for students today, 12/7 from 3:15-4:15pm in the Faunce Underground. Students will be presenting their final projects in Scratch and engineering/design. Anyone interested in STEM outreach in Providence is welcome to drop by (especially past teachers!).

posts.title: FREE Contemporary Dance Workshop TODAY!
posts.description: Body & Sole is hosting a FREE contemporary dance workshop TODAY, Friday, December 7 from 4-5:30 in Ashamu Dance Studio taught by SARAH-K, Artistic Director of Boston-based dance company STATIC NOYZE.  Relax and have some fun before finals really kick in and come take this sure-to-be-amazing contemporary class!  All dance experience levels welcome!  Bring your friends.

posts.title: Weihnachtsmarkt: GERMAN Christmas Market TONIGHT!
posts.description:
Weihnachtsmarkt: German Christmas Market!

Want to get into the holiday spirit? Please join the Brown German Club and DUG for Christmas Kaffeestunde and Weihnachtsmarkt, TONIGHT, Friday December 7th, from 5:00-7:00pm at 190 Hope Street! There will be fabulous music, great food, fun crafts, and an all around good time will be had by all. Pluse those who attend get to take home a gift! And who doesn't love gifts? Really? So come on out tonight and celebrate the Christmas season, German style!

posts.title: Apply to the annual Consulting Conference at Brown
posts.description:
Brown Collegiate Consulting Group is hosting a NATIONAL CONSULTING CONFERENCE on February 1-2, 2013 here at Brown. We are bringing together a SELECT GROUP of 120 students from universities across the U.S, as well as over 20 industry leaders and consultants, to educate, train, & inspire the best minds to pursue a CAREER IN CONSULTING.

Learn more about the event & submit an application to attend the conference at http://collegiateconsulting.org/#!/conference. Application deadline is DECEMBER 9th.
